data.title: Sail away - May. 16, 2002
data.meta_description: The Kyiv Yacht Club thrown a season-opening barbecue bash; ARTEast stages a Party Congress to auction off… - May. 16, 2002. By Interns
data.text:
The Kyiv Yacht Club thrown a season-opening barbecue bash; ARTEast stages a Party Congress to auction off a collection of socialist-realism art; and the Serge Lefer International Dance Competition opens.

FONT face=”Times New Roman”>

AUCTION: Congress Party. ArtEast gets in the spirit of socialist realism by throwing a Party Congress‑themed soiree – complete with VIP guest‑comrades, vodka, caviar, shashlyk, medal presentations and art auction. Pre‑bidding is an option, but registration to the party is limited to 60 people. ARTEast. Sun., May 19. Tickets $10. For details contact ARTEast at 229‑6552, [email protected] or via http://www.arteast.org.

Events

PARTY: Kyiv Yacht Club. Commodore Pete O’Brien and First Mate of Partying Mike Finko host a season‑opening BBQ/Beach Party at their Obolon naval base. The party is open to anyone who likes sailing or who thinks they may like it. And there are free hamburgers, hotdogs and beer while supplies last – and BYOB contributions are also welcome. Obolon Yacht Club Boat House. Sat. May 18, 2 p.m. KYC is also offering shuttle‑service from Golden Gate Pub at 2 p.m. and 3 p.m. For details or directions write to [email protected].

Music

CONCERT: My Friend the Truck and I. Infrequent guests to the capital, the five‑year‑old Dnipropetrovsk‑based band serves up a combination of funk, hardcore, jazz, hip‑hop and folk – but My Friend also describes its music as “extremist pop.” Stoned Baboon. Sat., May 18, 8 p.m. Tickets Hr. 20.

CONCERT: Yegor Letov. The former front man of rock‑band Gragdanskaya Oborona, Letov’s performing solo these days. Lavra Gallery. Mon., May 20, 19 p.m. Tickets Hr. 30.

CONCERT: Diana Gurtskaya. The young Russian singer performs in Kyiv for the first time. Ukraina Palace. Mon., May 20, 7 p.m. Tickets Hr 130‑Hr 280. To order tickets call 263‑0851.

CONCERT: “Smash Hits of the Year.” More or less all the familiar faces from the Ukrainian pop industry are gathering to present what they’re calling the “new songs of the new epoch.” The cast includes Ani Lorak, Kateryna Buzhynska, Natalia Mogylevska, Ex‑Presidents and Igrushki. Ukraina Palace. Wed., May 22, 7 p.m. Tickets Hr 10‑Hr 60. For more information call 247‑2476.

CONCERT: Lyube. The red‑blooded Russian band performs music of a patriotic vein from its new “Let’s Drink to …” program – as it’s been doing since the late 1980s. Ukraina Palace. Sat., May 18, 7 p.m. Tickets Hr 300‑Hr 450. To order tickets call 238‑2022.

CONCERT: Pikardiyska Tertsiya. This all‑male, award‑winning vocal sextet from Lviv generally sings a capela or with minimal instrumental input – and performs within the framework of the Kyiv May Festival. National Philharmonic. Sat., May 18, 7 p.m. For more information call 228‑1697.

CONCERT: Ruky Verkh. The Russian gansta‑popster duo brings its “Leave If You Can” tour to Kyiv. Obolon Show Park (6‑8 Heroyiv Stalingrada). Sat., May 18, 8 p.m.

Arts

THEATER: “Kassandra.” Kyiv’s Experimental Theater and director Yelena Bogatireva premieres a play based on the work of Lesya Ukrainka and Hans Eric Nossak – while actress Viktoria plays the lead. Experimental Theater. Sat., May 18, 7 p.m. Tickets Hr 5‑Hr 15.

EXHIBITION: “The Phenomenon of Ukrainian Avant‑Garde 1910‑35.” Opening this weekend the exhibition features avant‑garde works by artists including Palmov, Bogomazov and Yermilov. National Art Museum. Opens Sat., May, 18, 10 a.m.‑ 5 p.m. Museum closed Fridays.

EVENT: The 4th International Serge Lefer Ballet Competition. Named in honor of the Kyiv‑born dancer who became famous in France through the Grand Opera in Paris and the French Choreography Academy, the competition is divided into two components: solo and duet dancing and choreography. Participants also compete in junior and senior age classifications. National Opera. Sat., May 18 through Fri., May 24. May 19‑May 21, 3 p.m.‑10 p.m.; May 22, 6 p.m.‑10 p.m.; Gala Concert on May 24, 6 p.m. For tickets call 229‑1169.

EXHIBITION: “Ensemble.” The exhibition features the creative works of the French artist Christine Jean – with paintings on canvas, paper, wood and stone. French Cultural Center. Through June 20.

Events

FLOWER SHOW: “Kyiv Spring 2002” International Floral Competition. FSU performers Laima Vaikile, Kristina Orbakaite, Dmitry Malikov and Murat Nasyrov join their Ukrainian counterparts Natalia Mogilevska, Yevgenia Vlasova and the Sevastopol Dance Theater in what promises to be one of the best‑smelling shows of the season. Ukraina Palace. Sun., May 19, 7 p.m. Ticket Hr 50‑Hr 600. For more information call 578‑1550.

TRADE FAIR: 10th International Kyiv Autoshow. Manufacturers from some 20 countries blow their horns and hawk their wares – BMW, Honda, Mazda, Mitsubishi, Opel, Renault, Saab, Volkswagen, Volvo, VAZ, GAZ and KAMAZ as well as AutoZAZ, KrAZ and LAZ among them. Expo Center. Tues., May 21‑ Sun., May 26, 10a.m.‑5 p.m. Admission Hr 8 For more information call 239‑2704.
